Key Match Events: Simons' three-point play gave the Blazers the lead for good at 103-102 with 23.5 seconds remaining.
Simons hit two more free throws with 5.4 seconds left, giving Portland a 105-102 lead.
Giannis Antetokounmpo hit two free throws to give the Bucks a 102-100 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Portland snapped a two-game skid and won for the third time in five games.
Milwaukee has lost two straight and four of five, with each loss to teams with sub-.500 records.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Green's seven 3-pointers matched his career high.
Simons finished with 28 points and Deni Avdija finished with 19 points.
Others: The Trail Blazers beat the Milwaukee Bucks 105-102 on Saturday night.
Antetokounmpo finished with 31 points and 11 rebounds, and AJ Green added 21 points on seven 3-pointers.
